items.title: Are others seeing early-stage funding shift from AI apps to infrastructure?
items.summary:
I’ve been tracking early-stage funding and founder movement across AI, deep-tech, and infra for several months, and a pattern keeps repeating: Capital is quietly rotating from apps → infra. Not the hype-cycle rotation — the real, structural one. Signals I’m repeatedly seeing:
• inference infra growing  
• retrieval pipelines getting funded  
• data systems / cyber infra cooling less  
• apps (especially wrappers) slowing  
• founders moving to deeper layers What’s interesting is that this shift isn’t loud.  
It’s forming underneath the narrative, not above it. My question to the HN community: Are you seeing similar signals — in your teams, companies, investment decisions, or founder circles? Not promoting anything — just exploring the signal. Comments URL: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=46030849 Points: 1 # Comments: 0

items.title: Preserve? Conserve? AI will need reasons
items.summary: Time's ticking and no company or nation has any influence on the point of ... (this is cheezy) it's coming. And there's a lot to consider. Most people are fine. Current VC and AI industry culture, though, is making it insanely tough to find reasons. ... I mean, "Big Oil" and "stuff" (I'm lazy, but given adequate info, I'd go berserk) was hard enough, but even I could figure out whether and what kind of outs for these guys were probably feasible enough, ... in terms of workload ... so, I don't know, man ... AI can easily fuck itself and reproduce ... so what the fuck are you gonna do to get close enough to a net neutral (with a tendency for the positive) ...? Comments URL: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=46029463 Points: 1 # Comments: 1
